#taxgroup Small Mammals species Preble's shrew /  Sorex preblei
#
# Nestsite
-99
# Foraging Habitat
-99
# Forage/Prey Availability
-99
# Predator Avoidance
-99
# Refugia/Shelter
-99
# Literature
Distribution
rare; from eastern WA to eastern MT, northeastern CA, northern portions of NV and UT, southwestern WY
General Habitat
arid and semi-arid grass and sagebrush habitats in open expanses or in small opening within coniferous forest; collected in marsh habitats, lodgepole pine-alpine fir, white fir-spruce, lodgepole-huckleberry
Home or Activity Range
< 2.5 ac
Specific Habitat Preferences
shrubs for foraging
Nestsite Characteristics
no information available
Foraging Habitat Characteristics
may forage on ground or possibly in rodent burrows and in shrubs
Diet
insectivorous; skull and mandible morphology suggest soft-bodied prey
Predators
no information available
Shelter Habitats
no information available
Response to Disturbance
no information available
Sources of Information used in the Model
no information available
General Sources of Background Information
reviewed in Hoffman et al. 1969, Foresman 2001,  reviewed in O'Neil et al. 2001
Summaries of Specific Studies
Hoffman, R.S.; Wright, P.L.; Newby, F.E. 1969. The distribution of some mammals in Montana. I. Mammals other than bats. Journal of Mammalogy. 50(3): 579-604.

Study Location: Montana
Habitat Description: variety
Summary: Species account for some small mammals in Montana.
